title: Bizarre homemade version of BBC drama Moorside goes viral
text:
Bizarre homemade version of BBC drama Moorside goes viral Bizarre homemade version of BBC drama Moorside goes viral THE Moorside thrust the horrific fake kidnapping of nine-year-old Shannon Matthews back into the limelight earlier this month. / Published 23rd February 2017 
The two-part BBC drama took the country by storm with the nation once more gripped by the unthinkable events surrounding the schoolgirl’s disappearance in 2008. 
The later arrest and conviction of her mum Karen Matthews – revealed as being behind the wicked plot – once again hit the headlines. 
The programme pulled in a huge audience as viewers tuned in to see the crime retelling – but it has now gone one step further. 
Fans of the show have even started making their own re-enactments, with one particularly bizarre version getting more than one million shares on Facebook. 
FACEBOOK/JESSWALL/PA DRAMA: A video emerged online showing friends re-enacting scenes from The Moorside 
In the viral clip, three friends act out the roles of Karen, Karen’s best pal Julie and Karen’s disgraced partner, Craig. 
The friends act out the moment Julie confronts Karen about knowing where Shannon was being kept. 
It comes to an end with Karen and Craig pleading for the safe return of their little one, while another friend laughs off-screen. 
The video was posted to Facebook shortly after the TV show was aired and has now been watched 1.4 million times. 
FACEBOOK/JESSWALL VIRAL: The video has been shared over a million times Shannon Matthews: the kidnapping that SHOCKED Britain Wednesday, 15th February 2017 In 2008, the nation was gripped as police searched for missing school girl Shannon Matthews on an estate in Dewsbury, Lancashire. When it turned out her own mother had kidnapped, drugged and tied up in a flat in a sick plot to pocket the £50,000 reward, Britain was shocked. 1 / 17 Getty Images Karen Matthews after her arrest 
Mum-of-seven Karen came up with the despicable plan to cash in on reward money offered for the return of the missing child. 
In collusion with Karen's boyfriend’s uncle, Michael Donovan, Shannon was drugged and held captive in the base of a divan bed before an anonymous tip led to her discovery more than three weeks after she had been reported missing.
